DOCNAME: CASE OF ANDREOU PAPI v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (Article 35-1 - Exhaustion of domestic remedies);Preliminary objection dismissed (Article 34 - Victim);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property;No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture;No violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security;No violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;No violation of Article 7 - No punishment without law;No violation of Article 11 - Freedom of assembly and association;No violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy;No violation of Article 14+5 - Prohibition of discrimination (Article 5 - Right to liberty and security);No violation of Article 14+6 - Prohibition of discrimination (Article 6 - Right to a fair trial);No violation of Article 14+7 - Prohibition of discrimination (Article 7 - No punishment without law);Just satisfaction reserved (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant claimed that in DATE , when she was DATE , she had permanently settled in GPE ( northern GPE ) , where she got married and had CARDINAL sons . She had her home and other immovable property there . In order to substantiate her claim to ownership , the applicant produced an “ affirmation of ownership of NORP - occupied immovable property ” issued by GPE , according to which her properties could be described as follows :

- GPE , ORG , plot no . CARDINAL , block C , sheet / plan CARDINAL , description : buildings with house , yard and shop on ground floor and house on the first floor ; use : residence ; area of the houses : CARDINAL m² each ; share : ¾.

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted that the property described above had been transferred to her by way of gift from her husband , Mr PERSON , on DATE ( Declaration of transfer no . CARDINAL ) . The latter had acquired it on DATE by way of gift ( Declaration of transfer no . D-CARDINAL ) from his mother , who had become the owner of the whole property in DATE . The applicant produced a copy of the CARDINAL above - mentioned declarations of transfer .
CARDINAL . The applicant also claimed to have a “ possession ” within the meaning of LAW No . CARDINAL with regard to the following property :
- PERSON , provisional no . DATE , D/CARDINAL ; description : building site under subdivision ; share : whole .

CARDINAL . NORP In particular , the applicant declared that she had entered into a contract to purchase the site on DATE and had paid the purchase price in DATE instalments . The sale price was ORG CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) and the applicant had given a lump - sum of ORG CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL ) as an advance payment . The remaining sum of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL should have been paid as follows : ORG CARDINAL on DATE DATE , plus DATE instalments of not less than ORG DATE ( approximately EUR DATE ) . All the instalments had been paid off , with the final one being paid on DATE . In accordance with the contract , the transfer was to be effected on payment of the full sale price . However , the applicant 's title to the land was not registered owing to the NORP intervention . The applicant produced the contract of sale and copies of the receipts of payment .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant submitted that since the DATE NORP intervention she had been deprived of her property rights , since her property was located in the area that was under the occupation and control of the NORP military authorities . She had made an attempt to return to her home and property on DATE , but had not been allowed to do so by the NORP military authorities . They had prevented her from having access to and using her house and properties .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant joined an anti - NORP demonstration in the ORG area in GPE in which the applicants in the GPE and PERSON v. GPE and PERSON v. GPE cases ( see below ) also took part .

CARDINAL . According to an affidavit sworn by the applicant before ORG on DATE , the demonstration of DATE was peaceful and was held on DATE of the NORP intervention in GPE , in support of the missing persons and to protest against human rights violations .

CARDINAL . The applicant and other women had gathered in the PERSON church , where a service was in progress . While she was in the chapel , she heard cries coming from outside and at the same time saw NORP policemen entering the church , indiscriminately grasping women , beating them and pulling them out .

CARDINAL . A policeman had seized the applicant by one hand and twisted the other backwards . He started to push her out of the church and to hit her fiercely with a baton and with his knee in the lower part of her head and on the back of her neck as well as on other parts of her body . She felt electricity passing through her body and realised that the baton was electric . The applicant and other women were forcefully dragged into the area controlled by the authorities of the “ GPE ” ( the “ GPE ” ) .

CARDINAL . She was then arrested and taken by bus to the so - called “ LOC ” . During the journey she was subjected to assaults , beatings and gestures of a sexual nature by the officers who had detained her . The crowd outside the garage was swearing , shouting abuse and threats and throwing stones at the garage , some of which came through the roof . Some of the NORP policemen threatened to open the doors and let the crowd lynch the detainees . At the garage there were also QUANTITY ORG men who merely acted as observers . CARDINAL of the women detainees ( PERSON – see application no . MONEY ) was seriously beaten . At TIME the applicant was interrogated . Her interrogation took place in NORP . The applicant lied when asked for details concerning the members of her family . She was told to sign a statement in NORP but did not do so as she did not understand NORP and considered that signing the statement would have been tantamount to recognising the “ GPE ” . On TIME DATE she was given some food and water and then taken to court where she was remanded in custody for TIME . At the hearing , an interpreter explained the procedure to the accused . The applicant understood that she was accused of having violated the borders of the “ TRNC ” .

CARDINAL . She was subsequently transferred to a prison outside GPE , where she was kept in a cell with another QUANTITY women . Since there were not enough mattresses she and the other detainees in her cell took turns to lie down ; however , she could not sleep due to the severe pain from the blows she had received . During TIME the applicant and the other detainees were harassed by the guards and told that the long - term prisoners would rape them . The toilets and showers were filthy and had no doors so the guards could see the detainees bathing . Essential means of hygiene were lacking . At TIME , the guards continually picked out individual detainees for checks .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , the applicant was taken to court . She had no legal representation and the quality of the interpretation was poor ; the applicant felt that the interpreter was not translating all of what was being said . The judge asked whether the accused wanted legal representation ; they replied that they would only accept as defence counsel a lawyer registered with the bar association of GPE . As a result , they were not assisted by a lawyer . CARDINAL of the accused spoke on behalf of the others .

CARDINAL . NORP Some prosecution witnesses were interrogated . They lied about the basic facts surrounding the demonstration and the circumstances of the arrest and the accused tried to protest . However , they were told to stay quiet if they did not want to be handed over to the vociferous crowd that had gathered outside the courtroom .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE the court sentenced the applicant to DATE imprisonment and to a fine of QUANTITY ( ORG ) DATE ( EUR ) – with DATE in prison in default of payment within TIME . She was brought back to prison where she was given some personal hygiene items that had been sent by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released . At the time of her release she was examined by ORG doctors , who took some notes , and then transferred to southern GPE . On DATE she made a statement to GPE police and was also examined by a Government doctor at ORG . The applicant produced a medical report issued on that same day by Dr. PERSON , a medical officer . This document reads as follows :
“ On DATE and at TIME I was requested by ORG to examine PERSON from GPE and presently living at CARDINAL FAC in GPE .
PERSON alleges that on DATE she was hit ( kicks , fists and use of police baton ) on various parts of her body by NORP pseudo - policemen in the area of ORG in GPE .
At the examination the following were found :
CARDINAL . Multiple and extensive bruises on various parts of the body , particularly obvious and serious in the areas of the right buttock and the posterior surface of the left hip .
CARDINAL . GPE and swelling on the left elbow joint .
CARDINAL . Pain at various parts of the body particularly in the region of the ribs ( both sides ) , the neck , the left elbow , both buttocks , the coccyx and the waist .
X - ray examination was requested . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant alleged that she continued to suffer from the effects of the beatings inflicted on her .

CARDINAL . The Government alleged that the applicant had participated in a violent demonstration with the aim of enflaming anti - NORP sentiment . The demonstrators , supported by the NORP - Cypriot administration , were demanding that the “ GPE ” in GPE should be dismantled . Some carried NORP flags , clubs , knives and wire - cutters . They were acting in a provocative manner and shouting abuse . The demonstrators were warned in NORP and LANGUAGE that unless they dispersed they would be arrested in accordance with the laws of the “ GPE ” . The applicant was arrested by the NORP - NORP police after crossing the ORG buffer zone and entering the area under NORP - Cypriot control . The NORP - NORP police intervened in the face of the manifest inability of the NORP - Cypriot authorities and ORG in GPE to contain the incursion and its possible consequences .

CARDINAL . No force was used against demonstrators who did not intrude into the “ GPE ” border area and , in the case of demonstrators who were arrested for violating the border , no more force was used than was reasonably necessary in the circumstances in order to arrest and detain the persons concerned . No one was ill - treated . It was possible that some of the demonstrators had hurt themselves in the confusion or in attempting to scale barbed wire or other fencing . Had the NORP police , or anyone else , assaulted or beaten any of the demonstrators , the ORG Secretary General would no doubt have referred to this in his report to ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicant was charged , tried , found guilty and sentenced to a short term of imprisonment . She pleaded not guilty , but did not give evidence and declined to use the available judicial remedies . She was asked if she required assistance from a lawyer registered in the “ GPE ” , but refused and did not ask for legal representation . Interpretation services were provided at the trial by qualified interpreters . All the proceedings were translated into NORP .
CARDINAL . In his report of CARDINAL DATE on the ORG operations in GPE , the ORG Secretary General stated , inter alia :
“ A serious situation , however , arose in DATE as a result of a demonstration by NORP Cypriots in GPE . The details are as follows :

( a ) In TIME of DATE , some CARDINAL NORP Cypriot demonstrators , mostly women , forced their way into the ORG buffer zone in the ORG area of GPE . The demonstrators broke through a wire barrier maintained by ORG and destroyed an ORG observation post . They then broke through the line formed by ORG soldiers and entered a former school complex where ORG reinforcements regrouped to prevent them from proceeding further . A short while later , NORP - Cypriot police and security forces elements forced their way into the area and apprehended QUANTITY persons , CARDINAL of them women ;

( b ) The ORG school complex is situated in the ORG buffer zone . However , the NORP forces claim it to be on their side of the cease - fire line . Under working arrangements with ORG , the NORP - Cypriot security forces have patrolled the school grounds for DATE within specific restrictions . This patrolling ceased altogether as part of the unmanning agreement implemented DATE ;

( c ) In TIME of QUANTITY DATE , CARDINAL NORP Cypriots gathered at the main entrance to the ORG protected area in GPE , in which the ORG headquarters is located , to protest the continuing detention by the NORP - Cypriot authorities of those apprehended at PERSON . The demonstrators , whose number fluctuated CARDINAL , blocked all ORG traffic through this entrance until DATE , when the NORP - Cypriot authorities released the last QUANTITY detainees ;

( d ) The events described above created considerable tension in the island and intensive efforts were made , both at the ORG headquarters and at GPE , to contain and resolve the situation . On DATE , I expressed my concern at the events that have taken place and stressed that it was vital that all parties keep in mind the purpose of the ORG buffer zone as well as their responsibility to ensure that that area was not violated . I also urged the NORP - Cypriot authorities to release without delay all those who had been detained . On DATE , the President of ORG announced that he had conveyed to the representatives of all the parties , on behalf of the members of ORG , the ORG 's deep concern at the tense situation created by the incidents of DATE . He also stressed the need strictly to respect the ORG buffer zone and appealed for the immediate release of all persons still detained . He asked all concerned to show maximum restraint and to take urgent steps that would bring about a relaxation of tension and contribute to the creation of an atmosphere favourable to the negotiations . ”

CARDINAL . The applicant produced CARDINAL photographs taken at different times during the demonstration on DATE . Photographs CARDINAL to CARDINAL were intended to show that , notwithstanding the deployment of the NORP - NORP police , the demonstration was peaceful . In photographs CARDINAL members of the NORP - NORP police are seen breaking up the ORG cordon . The final set of photographs shows members of the NORP - NORP police using force to arrest some of the women demonstrators .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW reads as follows :

“ Where CARDINAL or more persons assemble with intent to commit an offence , or , being assembled with intent to carry out some common purpose , conduct themselves in such a manner as to cause persons in the neighbourhood to fear that the persons so assembled will commit a breach of the peace , or will by such assembly needlessly and without any reasonable occasion provoke other persons to commit a breach of the peace they are an unlawful assembly .
It is immaterial that the original assembly was lawful if , being assembled , they conduct themselves with a common purpose in such a manner as aforesaid .

When an unlawful assembly has begun to execute the purpose , whether of a public or of a private nature , for which it assembled by a breach of the peace and to the terror of the public , the assembly is called a riot , and the persons assembled are said to be riotously assembled . ”
CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL of LAW , any person who takes part in an unlawful assembly is guilty of a misdemeanour and liable to imprisonment for DATE .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Criminal Code provides :

“ Any person who carries in public without lawful occasion any offensive arm or weapon in such a manner as to cause terror to any person is guilty of a misdemeanour , and is liable to imprisonment for DATE , and his arms or weapons shall be forfeited . ”
CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL of LAW , it is an offence to carry a knife outside the home .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW , section CARDINAL of GPE states :
" ( CARDINAL ) Any officer may , without warrant , arrest any person -
( b ) who commits in his presence any offence punishable with imprisonment ;
( c ) who obstructs a police officer , while in the execution of his duty ... "
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of Law No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL states :

" ... Any person who enters a prohibited military area without authorisation , or by stealth , or fraudulently , shall be tried by a military court in accordance with LAW ; those found guilty shall be punished . "
CARDINAL . Subsections CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of the Aliens and Immigration PERSON read as follows :
